premises: If an athlete trains consistently, then their performance improves
incorrect conclusions: Their performance improving implies that an athlete trains consistently
Their performance not improving implies that an athlete trains consistently
An athlete not training consistently implies that their performance does not improve

premises: If a player eats a balanced diet, then their energy levels are high
A player eats a balanced diet
incorrect conclusions: Their energy levels are not high
Their energy levels being high implies that a player eats a balanced diet
Their energy levels not being high implies that a player eats a balanced diet
A player not eating a balanced diet implies that their energy levels are not high

premises: If a team practices regularly, then their coordination improves
incorrect conclusions: Their coordination improving implies that a team practices regularly
Their coordination not improving implies that a team practices regularly
A team not practicing regularly implies that their coordination does not improve
